answers.answer: You don't say where you are located.  There are several excellent facilities, mainly along the east coast, that have gastroenterology departments that could help your mother.  With that severe a weight loss it may be necessary for her to be on a TPN and under medical supervision.  When at home, it is essential that she follows a low-fat diet and recieves essential nourishment, it sounds as though she may not have been able to do that.  Does she live alone, is she currently in the hospital?  Perhaps if you gave us some more background information someone might be able to offer further suggestions.There are some surgical options, yet due to your mother's age, I question whether they would be considered, also it would depend on the causes of her chronic pancreatitis.  You are obviously very concerned for her health and well being.  I hope you will be able to find some help for her.  Please let us know a little more about her personal situation.  This disease can be very challenging.You have my prayers,Nanny

Just in case you want to investigate Pancreatitis a little bit better on your own, here are two EXCELLENT websites you can go to:http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health/digest/pubs/pancreas/pancreas.htmhttp://www.gastro.org/public/pancreatitis.htmlBest of luck to your mother.  I recently got over a bout with Acute Pancreatitis and it certainly is not much fun.  I got alot of good information from the websites listed above.  Hope you and yours have a Happy Holiday Season.
